title: Orientation & Introduction
description: Welcome to the Candidate Simulator — AI Edition. Learn about Candidate Coins, signatures, voter approval, and how the simulator scaffolds reading, writing, and speaking exercises.

tasks.prompt: Read the Orientation material to understand the simulator rules, Candidate Coins, signatures, and voter approval.
Type which office you want to run for: President, Senate, or House. Consider the thresholds for ballot access (President: 75 CC + 2.5%, Senate: 50 CC + 2.5%, House: 31 CC + 2.5%).
Use voice input to confirm your office choice and summarize the simulator rules in your own words.

narrator: Welcome to the Libertarian Federal Candidate Simulator. You begin with 50 Candidate Coins (CC), 0 signatures, and 0% voter approval. Every decision you make will affect these metrics, which represent your campaign resources, grassroots support, and voter trust.
readingSummary: Candidate Coins (CC) are your simulated campaign funds. 1 CC = $100 simulated.
Earn CC by passing quizzes and completing assignments.
Spend CC on campaign resources or communication coaching: Upload + Review (10 CC), Revision Suggestions (15 CC), Delivery Hints (20 CC).
Scoring: Quizzes → Signatures, 100 signatures = 1% voter approval, bonus CC for high quiz scores.
Penalties: wrong multiple-choice = –1 CC, wrong open-ended = –50 signatures, retake mistakes double penalties.
Key rule: Reading tasks → read, Writing tasks → type, Speaking tasks → use voice input.

tasksDetails.prompt: Read Orientation and Candidate Coins rules.
Enter the office you plan to run for.
Confirm your choice and summarize the simulator rules verbally.
